channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why handing over total control to AI agents would be a huge mistake
item.description: AI agents have set the tech industry abuzz. Unlike chatbots, these groundbreaking new systems operate outside of a chat window, navigating multiple ap...

item.title: ‘Gradually then suddenly’: Is AI job displacement following this pattern?
item.description: Many technological shifts have coincided with economic downturns. Will 2025 be the year AI not only augments jobs but starts to replace them?

item.title: BlueHalo wins $30M follow-on contract with the U.S. Navy
item.description: The award follows the U.S. Navy's $92.6M MESR contract awarded to VideoRay in May, which BlueHalo acquired later last year. The post BlueHalo wins $30...

item.title: The open-source AI debate: Why selective transparency poses a serious risk
item.description: It is misleading to call AI open source when no one can look at, experiment with and understand each element that went into creating it.

item.title: The future of flight: How autonomous systems are shaping the next generation of UAVs
item.description: Fully autonomous UAVs open up possibilities for market growth, operational efficiency, and security, writes Swift Engineering's president. The post Th...

item.title: Recap: Check out the robots at ProMat and GTC 2025
item.description: Missed ProMat 2025 and/or NVIDIA GTC 2025? Our editorial staff was there, and recap what they learned in this episode. The post Recap: Check out the r...

item.title: The Download: saving the “doomsday glacier,” and Europe’s hopes for its rockets
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Inside a new...

item.title: Sanctuary AI uses NVIDIA Isaac Lab to accelerate robot training
item.description: Sanctuary AI uses Isaac Lab to train its hydraulic hands to perform cutting-edge manipulation tasks, in simulation and in reality. The post Sanctuary ...

item.title: Small models as paralegals: LexisNexis distills models to build AI assistant
item.description: LexisNexis fine-tuned Mistral models to build its Protege AI assistant, relying on distilled and small models for its AI platform.

item.title: IntuiCell augments off the shelf quadruped with a ‘digital nervous system’
item.description: IntuiCell created a physical AI agent capable of learning autonomously in a manner that mimics a biological nervous system. The post IntuiCell augment...

item.title: Inside a new quest to save the “doomsday glacier”
item.description: The Thwaites glacier is a fortress larger than Florida, a wall of ice that reaches nearly 4,000 feet above the bedrock of West Antarctica, guarding th...

item.title: Less is more: UC Berkeley and Google unlock LLM potential through simple sampling
item.description: With multiple sampling and self-verification, Gemini 1.5 Pro can outperform o1-preview in reasoning tasks.

item.title: OpenAI has released its first research into how using ChatGPT affects people’s emotional wellbeing
item.description: OpenAI says over 400 million people use ChatGPT every week. But how does interacting with it affect us? Does it make us more or less lonely? These are...

item.title: Autopsies can reveal intimate health details. Should they be kept private?
item.description: Over the past couple of weeks, I’ve been following news of the deaths of actor Gene Hackman and his wife, pianist Betsy Arakawa. It was heartbreaking ...

item.title: OpenAI’s new voice AI model gpt-4o-transcribe lets you add speech to your existing text apps in seconds
item.description: Three, all new proprietary voice models called gpt-4o-transcribe, gpt-4o-mini-transcribe and gpt-4o-mini-tts.

item.title: Advance Trustworthy AI and ML, and Identify Best Practices for Scaling AI
